alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 16 at 8:04PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Kankakee River from near Kankakee River State Park downstream to near Phelan Acres, including portions of Grundy and Will counties. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roads and streets will continue. Yards and other low-lying areas along the river will remain inundated by water and ice. Shifting of ice may damage structures along the shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM CST, river gauges continued to indicate a significant ice jam from near Phelan Acres upstream to near I-55. Flooding is ongoing and expected to continue while the ice jam remains in place. - A Flash Flood Watch remains in place for areas downstream of this ice jam due to the potential for sudden shifting or break of ice, which could rapidly flood new areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilmington and Lakewood Shores. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
